website_summaries.verdict: A uniquely designed reading light to be worn around the neck.
pros: Can be used for activities other than reading
An inexpensive light with a convenient rechargeable battery
4 different brightness settings and 2 beam options
Also has an auto shut-off function
cons: Some users think that even the lowest brightness setting is too bright

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazard!!!
customer_reviews.text: Warning!!!! After using this for nearly a year, this afternoon I got quite the scare. After removing the light from the USB charger, I set it down on the coffee table and left the room. About 30 seconds later I heard a loud hissing sound. The device had begun melting and smoke was pouring off of it from the where it charges. I immediately took it outside to watch it continue to melt. Had this been on my neck I would have been severely burned. I have contacted the company to make them aware.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ruffner

customer_reviews.title: Good choice at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Clever hands free light that I am using to illuminate a very detailed piece of needlework in progress. It is easy and comfortable to use, and provides many different levels of brightness. My only mild quibble is that the description should make it clear that you need access to a USB port to recharge the battery - something to consider when taking it away from home.
customer_reviews.author: reviewerb

customer_reviews.title: Want to love them - but can't!  Too strong and direct for all settings... :(
customer_reviews.text: These could be amazing. Bought three of them for bedtime book reading and they nearly work, but there's no setting that gives it enough diffuse light. They're all just too strong! If they could make it so that there would be at least one setting that would spread the light out much further vs giving such a sharp blast, these would be perfect... Please give a more ambient lighting function!
customer_reviews.author: Interested Reader

customer_reviews.title: This is worse than looking directly into a screen
customer_reviews.text: I wish they'd make a non blue light option. Blue light totally defeats the purpose of using a book light at night to reduce screen time. This is worse than looking directly into a screen; the light is blinding. I'd be horrified to use this product in public, like on a plane. You'll blind everyone around you and have a hard time seeing/repeatedly adjusting the stupid arms so your light is focused.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, it sits on the back of your neck ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light because the light over my nightstand just didn't shed enough light. I often read in bed, turning away from the lamp, so makes it tougher to read. This light works very well for that. Comfortable, it sits on the back of your neck and the dual lights can be adjusted to virtually any position. The only reason it didn't get a 5 star review is the lighting is ultra white LED. While some may like that, I don't. Fortunately the light has 3 brightness levels so I just use the lowest setting which provides A LOT of light. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sees Spots

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about this little light. I’ve found more uses for this than just about any gadget I’ve ever bought. Looking for things under furniture, reading, the trunk of your car at night, walking the dog at night, fixing things heck, you name it. This little guy is always in reach in my home and around my neck quite often. It comes with a plug in charger which is amazing. I rarely have to charge it though because the batteries last a long time. There are three settings and the brightest is pretty darn bright. I just ordered one for my Mother. If you need a hands free light this one won’t disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Locust

customer_reviews.title: Not good for bedtime reading
customer_reviews.text: Physically this light is great, and the spot and flood options work well. The 2-star review is due to the blue-white light it emits. A fundamental reason people will choose this light is to read at night without disturbing others. But as we are learning, blue light before bedtime disrupts natural sleep patterns. Unfortunately, for me this makes the light largely unusable. I’d recommend a much warmer LED or inclusion of a filter to reduce blue spectrum emissions.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Light is difficult to aim towards what I am attempting to read. It's certainly bright enough, but no help unless I'm using both hands to position it and hold it steady....leaving no hands to hold my book. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie C   Mack

customer_reviews.title: it's like I have a flashlight on
customer_reviews.text: This light is HUGE. I definitely didn't expect for it to be so massive around my neck and to hang so low. Nonetheless, this isn't my biggest complaint. My biggest complaint is the brightness of the light. I assume most people buy book lights in order to read at night without emitting too much light. If not, wouldn't they just use a regular lamp or a wall light? This light illuminates my entire bedroom! With only a single light on, it's like I have a flashlight on. Will be returning and trying something else out.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a week
customer_reviews.text: First off either light mode is really too bright for reading I'm bed and not disturbing your partner. Second the right bulb in mine stopped working after a week and only 3 light uses as I only ever used it to read in bed. If it worked long I would say that it would be preferable for me than a headlamp for camping or other activities just not reading.....but it's obviously not very well made.... going to return
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: I really thought I would like this more than I do.
customer_reviews.text: So, the light is definitely bright enough to read and do simple tasks, but it feels very white/blue and hurts my eyes a bit when reading. It also isn't very functional around my neck because my chest tends to get in the way, and it only points down, so it isn't super useful if you read at a different angle. Also, I didn't find it sturdy enough to stand up on its own or able to position around myself in a way that it would be a steady, constant light on a book. I ended up using a headlamp to get the lighting I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Cheap parts don’t last
customer_reviews.text: These worked great until about my fifth charge. I went to insert the charge cord And the USB receptacle broke off. I took the headset apart and it’s a cheap circuitboard and there was no way to reattach it. Usually on circuit boards you reinforce the USB charging piece with a wire over it at least that’s the way I used to do it when I build circuit boards.
customer_reviews.author: T Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.......almost
customer_reviews.text: This suits my needs very well. I was looking for something to illuminate my hands/lap as I do sewing and repairs. I could wear a headlamp and often do for tasks, but with this I can be in front of the TV, look down at my work, and then back up at the TV without shining a headlamp light on the TV. Often I don't even use both sides, as the light from just one can be enough to light my work area. My only wish is that the light temperature was more natural/warm. I' not a fan of that cool white LED color and sometimes I require lighting that is more daylight realistic.
customer_reviews.author: chromacosmic

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me, so I am not sure on the shipping speed. The package came in good condition. I like the settings of the lights. The instructions were clear and easy to understand. The lights are bright for reading in the dark and needs minimal adjustments. It also comes with a USB charger, and charges fast. My only thing is that when I am laying in bed, reading, with the light the back peice that sits on my neck starts to become irritating. Overall I rate this 5 stars because I like the different lights settings as well as the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this. At first it seems weird
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with a bit of trepidation because there are so many near identical products out there and what appear to be a ton of fake reviews. :-| Anyway, I really like this. At first it seems weird, but it really does the job of lighting up a book. Beats a clip on light hands down. Charged fine, definitely bright enough I usually don't need to put it beyond the lowest setting. Seems well built and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Reading, needlework, knitting, crocheting etc....must-have little light!
customer_reviews.text: I love this light! I crochet at night and the lamp I have is just too dull and I cannot aim it. This is awesome.....fits around your neck and pin points exactly where you need the light. And it recharges with usb cord... Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A. You

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: Since I need a lot of light to read, I thought this would help me at night to read in bed. Nope. First of all, it hurts the back of my neck when I'm resting against the pillow. But worst of all is that the light, quite weak in any event, angles down no matter how I twist it. It just doesn't light up the book page no matter what. Not recommended at all. A miner's lamp would be better!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This was a recommendation from Robin at Creative RV. I love that it is USB rechargeable and hands free. So far I used it several nights on our last camping adventure to read after dark. It worked great and I prefer it over my clip on book light. I could get up for a drink, bathroom break or whatever and just keep my light with me. Much better than switching on the bright overhead camper lights, or waking up the sleeping husband. Would be great for working with your hands anywhere there is loo light. Have you ever tried to cook outside in the dark or inside a backpackers cabin? I have and wish I had this light back then.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good for bedtime reading.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I get to bed after my wife and I don't want to turn on my regular reading light. Ive tried several other lights and they get me by but they aren't great. either they clip to the book, but don't light the page or bright enough but awkward to position. Tried this, price seemed reasonable. This may be the one. I tried reading last night using only one of the lights and was very pleased with results. Only giving 3 stars for battery because I really haven't tested it yet, just got them.
customer_reviews.author: xrayguy

customer_reviews.title: Sweet relief from improper lighting!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every kind of clip-on book light I could find, and now have quite a collection. This one is qualitatively superior to each by far. It’s comfortable to wear, each side is highly adjustable because it’s flexible, and each side has its own light switch with three levels of focusing your light. (Keep it on if you need to make a quick trip in the dark; no stubbed toes!) This is the way to go if you enjoy reading at night, it is so nice to be able to shine full light right where you want/need it; far superior in my experience to the book clip-on lights that I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Unique and Useful Product
customer_reviews.text: Having grown tired of reaching for a lamp or an extended lightbulb while reading, I found a great alternative upon purchasing and receiving the CeSunglight Reading Light. Best used wrapped behind your neck, the rubberized band can be positioned however it's needed best to cast a strong glow onto whatever you're reading. This is a must-have gadget for anyone who enjoys reading at night or without the use of unnecessary electricity and lighting. Also too, the battery life is superb!
customer_reviews.author: JTH

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I do a lot of crocheting and need good light. Having this hanging around my neck providing the bright light just where I need it is perfect. The 3 settings for the lights makes it easy for me to adjust, along with the flexible arms. It is so easy and convenient to recharge. I don't even feel it on my neck while working. I can see where this product would be helpful in so many areas. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth M. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for reading in bed. They hang on your neck comfortably and provide great light. What I like most about them is you can set different levels of light. You can use one side or the other or both at the same time. They have two different light levels (High and low) They are really sturdy. My husband uses them for technical work and is able to shine light in the smallest of area. That it hangs around your neck gives you a lot more angles to choose from as opposed to the lights that you where around you head (which aren't very comfortable and hard to direct light).
customer_reviews.author: OMP888

customer_reviews.title: So good I ordered 2 more!
customer_reviews.text: This light is bright! It is adjustable though so don't worry. I looked at many different types of reading lights and have tried some of them but this is the most convenient imo. I like that you don't have to like for somewhere to clip it or worry about clipping it to the book. This simply goes around the back of your neck and you just point to where you want light. This is great for reading in rooms that don't get too much light and helps prevent eye fatigue. My kids kept using the light to read so I ordered more. I've had mine for about a year and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: crystal24

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little reading light.
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting a second. After 3 years of daily use and young ones being rough with it, one side finally gave out. However, in those 3 years it had great brightness, a long life, was comfortable on my neck, and recharged easily. I've used it for bedtime reading to my little ones. I child easily read with the lights in their room off. It had performed marvelously and has made many travels. Would gladly recommend to anyone looking for a reading lamp.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Cam

customer_reviews.title: great product for 10 months
customer_reviews.text: I got this to read bedtime stories to my daughters. The LED light is a bit too focused, but is otherwise nice. I like the way it adjusts to fit around your neck and allows you to point the light at your book while you are reading. I like that it recharges by USB instead of needing you to replace batteries. Unfortunately, one of the two flexible arms broke from metal fatigue after about 9-10 months of daily use. It's still useable (I've duct taped it together to keep the electrical wires from getting torn) but it's no longer adjustable. I found this somewhat disappointing, though my overall opinion remains positive.
customer_reviews.author: LKT

customer_reviews.title: Lost function quickly
customer_reviews.text: Thus worked great for 4 months, making it possible for me to work on fine needlepoint. However, now it has started flickering... always on one side and when it's on high on the other side. Also, it does not last nearly as long on a charge, so I have to charge it more than once a day. Very disappointed that after just 4 months I have to buy a new light.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon G. Mensing

customer_reviews.title: bright light, holds charge forever
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing!!! It is larger than you think it is...but when you adjust, it is just great. Comfortable to wear in bed or walking around in the dark (I like this much better than a headlamp). I love that I can illuminate the whole page instead of a tiny spot like those clip to the book type lights. Very adjustable amount of light (6 levels total, and you can use one or both ends) and extremely flexible/posable. And holds a charge for so long that a couple of weeks after I bought it, the light was very feeble and I thought something was wrong...and realized I had not charged since it arrived! Very well done product.
customer_reviews.author: FarmWoman

customer_reviews.title: ADORE this product
customer_reviews.text: My wife adores this product and uses it frequently. It wraps around her neck so she can use it hands free. She also wraps it around furniture (chair, headboard) so she can read at night without an overhead light or lamp disturbing me. Battery life is superb, though she typically only uses one side of the light, and the first click. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Frantzen

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the smartest designs! Each side has three light settings, easy to use, and it's rechargeable so no batteries required, and at full charge it has incredibly long life. I love it and use it at home to read or when I need a little lighting to see when I be get up at night. Also use it at work. I work back stage at a Vegas show and it really helps to do the quick changes at side stage. I don't know how I ever survived before buying it. .lol.
customer_reviews.author: PixieShopper

customer_reviews.title: Convenient when you need light to read by
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have one each, and we use them on airplane flights, as well as in situations in hotels (etc) where the reading light provided is often NOT bright enough to actually read. Have also used them on photo safaris inside our tent/room at night after the generator is turned off, or if the 24 hr light is dim (which is often the case). In every use, this product has performed as advertised, and we have been very pleased. We would purchase again if anything ever happens to the ones we presently have. We have had them, and used them only intermittently for several years.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Spot On Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pin point, rechargeable light that can be focused on my cross stitch and Lego building projects that I do while relaxing in my recliner. This product is perfect! It’s fits lightly around your neck and you can adjust the 2 beams to point at the best spot and have 3 selections for brightness. They also last many hours before having to recharge, which by the charges quickly. Now I can cross stitch and actually see what I’m doing. And with my tray of Legos on my lap, I can find pieces faster and comfortably do my builds. In short... these are SPOT ON Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie S. Burns

customer_reviews.title: It has three settings which I find useful for different times of the evening
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me. I am an up til midnight, awake again at 4 am to finish reading before work reader. This works well. It has three settings which I find useful for different times of the evening. If I'm leaning back in my bed, sometimes the blue battery hurts my neck, but I just lift it on top of my head like a headband and it works great. It probably looks silly, but who cares. The battery lasts a long time. I haven't timed it, but it lasts through many late nights before needing to be charged. I'm excited to take this on the airplane with me. It's much less disruptive than the overhead lights.
customer_reviews.author: Jane P.

customer_reviews.title: Damn fine light!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these, for night reading. I tried ordering two lap desks with lights from Sophia and Sam. They sent me the WRONG lap desks.....so wrong that we thought they were pads for our dog dishes. Returned them and waiting for my refund.... So, I said screw it, we can wad a blanket up on our lap and use our farm headlamps. They're old, smelly and have broodmare ick on them, so I researched and decided on these lamps. Best decision I've made in a while. Not only can we easily read with them, we can check the mares, find the dogs and shoot coyotes without changing lights.
customer_reviews.author: Pig Scum

customer_reviews.title: Not super bright, but works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for knitting and crocheting in lower light situations (or when I work with darker yarn). The lights aren't as bright as I expected, but I do like it. I especially like that the lights work independently from each other.
customer_reviews.author: Connie A

customer_reviews.title: Lights are bright. Will not stay balanced around your neck. If that you want an extra set of hands.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. Lights are bright. 3 separate light modes. My only complaint is that I cannot seem to get both light to aim in the same spot and stay. Seems to be a Stability? Weight distribution problem? They slip around your neck instead of staying centered. The center of the light is a hard plastic where you plug in the charger. Maybe that is the balance issue. I have tried. Will not stay in place. Hard to garden or use the light when it slips around. Unless you want to hold it in place. Otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Only buy if you want a one time use!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy unless you only want to use this once. I bought this used it till I needed to charge it. Ive tried charging it several times and it doesnt charge. Ive tried charging it using different outlets and ports nothing help. I charged it for 2 weeks and it did nothing. Its so weak I cannot even get a picture of it. Had I done this when I bought it. I would have returned it. I moved and didn't get a chance to use it till January of this year.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Handy light but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Great light for hands-free lighting. Unfortunately, this is the third one in less than a year. The first became really flaky charging. The micro-USB port is not very durable. Ordered a replacement and it started going bad within a week. One set of LEDs would not light and battery would not hold a charge. Returned it and just received third light. Hopefully it will be the best or I will give up on this product.
customer_reviews.author: F. J. A.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic light
customer_reviews.text: My wife got me one as a Christmas gift and it's fantastic. It's perfect for reading at night...no more dealing with an annoying clip-on book light that throws off the balance of the book in your hands and gets in the way of turning pages! The lights are super flexible and, more importantly, they stay in place. The rechargable battery is a huge plus in my book, and even though I don't need a floodlight AND a spotlight for reading, it's nice to know I have it if I want to use the light for other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: C. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great little light for reading or close work
customer_reviews.text: Great little light for reading or crocheting. I purchased this at Christmas for my grand daughter, who is an avid reader. She likes being able to read in bed and told me this was a great light. I crochet and recently had some issues with my eyes. I bought this light to see my crocheting work better. It’s working great for grandmom, too. The lights on both sides are adjustable. Best part no batteries needed! I plan to buy again for an upcoming friend’s birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Used
customer_reviews.text: After years of trying various "book lights" and "knitting lights" I find this is by far best for my needs. Perfect for knitting and close craft work, best for reading printed matter in a dimly lit room or while traveling (plane or train). I find the lowest light setting effective without being jarring, brighter settings helpful for close-work knitting and embroidery. Battery life is great; hasn't run out on long airline flights or extended craft sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good reading light but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good .... wish the floodlight setting was brighter. Spotlight setting is bright but not suitable for reading ..... and using both in tandem produces underlit areas on the sides .....with 2 bright spots in the middle. Double flood lights would be better for reading.....more even lighting.....But product I received does not have that option. Maybe the manufacturer will offer that in the future. Still ....a serviceable product that does a decent job and is inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, multiple uses, still going strong since purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Wife is a book worm. Loves reading HarleyQuinn romance specifically. A book light was in desperate need since she also likes to read in the dark while relaxing, none of the previous ones I bought were any good. Either not bright enough, clip broke way to easy, clip was not big enough to fit the book pages, ect.. Then I came across this while searching for different book lights. It is a huge difference. She LOVES the hands free aspect, LOVES how you can adjust the brightness and how you can wrap it around your neck or wrist. She even bought one for a resident at her care facility. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aedamus

customer_reviews.title: May be the light I have been looking for since I was 9.
customer_reviews.text: I think I may have finally found the light that I have been looking for. As a veteran of using a handheld flashlight under the sheets at night when I was a kid, I have progressed to using clip lights etc... I never found one that could center the light on the page without leaving shadows or adding weight to my book. I was even beginning to think about using a headlamp. I have only used this for awhile, it came charged and I haven't had to charge it yet so I don't know about the battery. I think this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, and great for migraine/photosensitive folks.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps a good charge and allowed me to repurpose the lamp on my bedside table (very small) which was bullying out all my other things. Now the little table has a rattan basket for glasses, this, hand lotion etc. And a charging stand for this, phone, Kindle and tablet (yes, I'm a wired, nerdy old lady). I love the adjustable light, because I get migraines and when I am headachey, I just turn off the lights and drape this, and I can operate even in the kitchen without turning on the overhead or extra pain.
customer_reviews.author: Shava Nerad

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Charging after a month of use
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this as I crochet in the evening and the table lamp never puts enough light directly on my project. The unit is comfortable around my neck; however I did find that when I positioned the light where I needed it that it would slide/bend back to the another position, but I was fine with it...but unfortunately after using it for about 6 weeks, it won't accept a charge. I used the same charger and it worked fine and the light would come on saying it was charging but now it won't light up and you can visibly see that the lights are not being charged. now I am back to square one.
customer_reviews.author: GAlderiso

customer_reviews.title: Such a useful gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use when doing top chain-stitching or other crafts when I need just a little extra illumination. It's marvelous for that. It's even fantastic for coloring or reading or anything else. Recharges quickly, has multiple settings for brightness on each light (for six total light levels), and it's not at all heavy around the neck. Quite a great buy for the crafter or reader who doesn't want all the lights on in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: A ChristyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only 10-12 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 11 months ago but only recently started using it (for hand sewing.) I've only used it about 10-12 hours and one of the lights stopped working. Nice light but terrible manufacturing quality.
customer_reviews.author: DAO

customer_reviews.title: I cannot begin to tell you what a great product this has been
customer_reviews.text: I cannot begin to tell you what a great product this has been. I've had mine for a year, and it has been extremely useful. It's not just for reading in bed. I use it all the time when working around the house. No matter where I am, with this thing around my neck I have light where I need it. I especially like it because it's rechargeable. I highly recommend this light.
customer_reviews.author: G. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Bright Rechargeable light for around neck
customer_reviews.text: So far it is a bright light for my knitting in the car on road trips during darkness. I can see very well yet hubby is not disturbed by the lights. It is also comfortable AND rechargeable too. I have learned if you have issues with this light the company will replace it within 1 year. No LED replacement lights but as I said if you have problems the company will replace it within 12 mos.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen O’Dell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Book Light!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for something like this for a while! So glad I found it! I love to read and sometimes stay up later than my husband likes to (he is an early bird). This light allows me to have the light I need to read and doesn't disturb his sleeping. There are other reading lights out there, but since this one goes around my neck, if I get up to go to the bathroom, etc., the light comes with me! It's very comfortable and flexible. I've even used it for other purposes. It comes with a charging cord so I'm never without light!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Awkward neck snake.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this. The idea is excellent and there was thought put into this little creation. However, a couple of minor details make it not-so-user-friendly. It's really big and awkward. Definitely better for home use and not for traveling. It feels like I'm wearing a little snake. I like snakes, but not while I'm reading. The plastic piece that goes behind your neck is bulky and uncomfortable while lying down. The 3 light settings are great, but the bulbs on the left side are slightly different in color than the bulbs on the right side, which is distracting.
customer_reviews.author: HC

customer_reviews.title: Who needs this much light to read at night?
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful spotlight! I can use it to comfortably see ships 4 miles out at sea in the dead of night! In all seriousness though, this light is brighter than my ceiling light and even in the day it can function as a high powered flashlight. Why??
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M.

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: Rechargeable, no-hands use, multiple settings. I bought this to read in bed, but I have also used it to visit the bathroom in hotels without turning on bright lights and for generally walking around in a power failure or walking on poorly lit sidewalks at night. Each side works separately with 3 settings, so it's versatile. Not as powerful as some old-fashioned battery flashlights, but plenty strong enough for most uses, especially indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice W.

customer_reviews.title: Super bright (sometimes too bright) but very handy
customer_reviews.text: This comes in so handy! I use it as a book light or when I crochet. I only wish there was at least one setting that wasn't quite so bright. It could use at least one dimmer setting. But I guess that's the nature of LED.
customer_reviews.author: Ciocia Kim

customer_reviews.title: Hard to position
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on good reviews that noted how easy it is to position the arms of this light. I haven't found that to be correct. It's very difficult to move the arms where I want them, with the light around my neck. I really wanted to like this light, but I actually wouldn't recommend it. I can't get it to shine on the part of the page I want it to shine on. Having two lights to focus doesn't actually help.
customer_reviews.author: Love Mephisto shoes

customer_reviews.title: Great little light, well designed, larger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This book light is great. It was larger than I expected. Each "wing" has two LEDs in them, and a switch rotates for each side between off, one LED or TWO LEDs. It is very well designed and is easier to use than the clip on type of book lights. I expect to use this not only for reading books but when working in dark areas where I need more light. It charges via a provided mini-USB cable. So, if you use it on a long trip, bring a portable usb chargeable battery as backup power. I have not tested to see how long the light lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Jochim

customer_reviews.title: Bright light when and where you need it.
customer_reviews.text: I love that the lights are adjustable and rechargeable. I use the light around my neck for knitting in dim light. I can direct the light exactly where I want it. Disappointed
